name: Northern Nubian Giraffe
description: In 2016, giraffe classification was revised, and the Rothschild’s giraffe kept by Prague Zoo was reclassified as the Northern Nubian Giraffe. Giraffes are the tallest living animals, with males commonly over five meters and females four to five meters.
food_note: Mainly leaves and shoots, occasionally flowers and fruits
image_alt: Northern Nubian Giraffe, photo: Jaroslav Šimek, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 3.5–4.8 m, tail length 80–110 cm, height 4.3–5.5 m, weight 450–1,900 kg
reproduction: The female is pregnant for 457 days and gives birth to 1 calf.
attractions: Giraffes inhabit sub-Saharan Africa, favoring bush landscapes with acacias and other trees. They feed almost exclusively on leaves at heights unreachable by other herbivores.
breeding: Giraffe breeding in our zoo began in 1954 with a Masai giraffe female, Lenka. Since 1970, we’ve kept Northern Nubian Giraffes.
